Description: Base of flaring-sided bowl, painted underglaze in blue and black with six-petalled flowers and a stylised bird (?). Exterior with black lines. Made of coarsely potted fritty earthenware; also white.
Bibliographic references: Wallis 1891 / Persian Ceramic Art Belonging to Mr F DuCane Godman, FRS: The Thirteenth Century Lustred Vases (Appendix pl.vii.6)
